wikipedia_page.main: Raymond William Harrison (21 June 1921 – June 2000) was an English professional association footballer who played as a centre forward in the Football League for Burnley, Doncaster Rovers and Grimsby Town. Harrison is best remembered for scoring the winning goal for Burnley in an FA Cup semi-final.In his later career he managed Frickley Colliery in the Midland League and ran a sports shop in Doncaster.
